intro: Sonninia vomitoria, commonly known as the vomiter plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers and hairy, broad leaves. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its unique appearance and historical use in traditional medicine, it has attracted attention from botanists and herbalists alike.
